main_definition: To initiate or start the operation of something, often with a forceful action.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Initiating a new project or venture
meanings_and_examples.example: The company launched a new line of eco-friendly products.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Starting an event, such as a festival or exhibition
meanings_and_examples.example: The city prepared to launch the annual arts and music festival.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Releasing a product into the market
meanings_and_examples.example: The tech company launched its latest smartphone model with great fanfare.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Communicating or broadcasting information, such as a news report or announcement
meanings_and_examples.example: The radio station launched an emergency alert about the approaching storm.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Setting off explosives with controlled force
meanings_and_examples.example: The demolition crew carefully launched charges to bring down the old building.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Beginning a space mission or launching a rocket into orbit
meanings_and_examples.example: NASA successfully launched its new Mars exploration rover.
